1.description: You see before yourself a long hallway with stairs at the end. There is nothing in the way.
1.tip: Call samurai.walk() to walk forward in the Player 'play_turn' method.

2.description: It is too dark to see anything, but you smell toads nearby.
2.tip: Use samurai.feel() to see what is in front. If it is None, walk; otherwise attack. Remember, you can only do one action per turn.
2.clue: Add an if/else condition with `space = samurai.feel()` and `if space is None:` to decide whether to samurai.attack() or samurai.walk().

3.description: The air feels thicker than before. There must be a horde of toads.
3.tip: Be careful not to die! Use samurai.hp to keep an eye on your health, and samurai.rest() to earn 10% of max health back.
3.clue: When there is no enemy ahead of you call samurai.rest() until health is full before walking forward.

4.description: You can hear bow strings being stretched.
4.tip: No new abilities this time, but be careful not to rest while taking damage. Save your previous health in a variable (for example prev_hp) and compare it each turn.
4.clue: Set prev_hp = samurai.hp at the end of each turn. If samurai.hp dropped since last turn then you're taking damage and should not rest.

5.description: You hear cries for help. Captives must need rescuing.
5.tip: Use space = samurai.feel() and check space is not None and space.is_captive() to detect captives, then call samurai.rescue(). Don't attack captives.
5.clue: Don't forget to constantly check if you're taking damage. Rest until your health is full if you aren't taking damage.

6.description: The wall behind you feels a bit further away in this room. And you hear more cries for help.
6.tip: You can walk backward by passing 'backward' as an argument to walk(). Same goes for feel(), rescue() and attack(). Archers have a limited attack distance.
6.clue: Walk backward if you are taking damage from afar and do not have enough health to attack. You may also want to consider walking backward until samurai.feel('backward').is_wall().

7.description: You feel a wall right in front of you and an opening behind you.
7.tip: You are not as effective at attacking backward. Use samurai.feel().is_wall() and samurai.pivot() to turn around.

8.description: You hear the mumbling of wizards. Beware of their deadly wands! Good thing you found a bow.
8.tip: Use samurai.look() to determine your surroundings, and samurai.shoot() to fire an arrow.
8.clue: Wizards are deadly but low in health. Kill them before they have time to attack.

9.description: Time to hone your skills and apply all of the abilities that you have learned.
9.clue: Don't just keep shooting the bow while you are being attacked from behind.

1.description: Silence. The room feels large, but empty. Luckily you have a map of this tower to help find the stairs.
1.tip: Use samurai.direction_of_stairs() to determine where the stairs are. Pass that value to samurai.walk() to move in that direction.

2.description: Another large room, but with several enemies blocking your way to the stairs.
2.tip: Just like walking, you can attack and feel in multiple directions (forward, left, right, backward).
2.clue: Call samurai.feel(direction).is_enemy() in each direction to make sure there isn't an enemy beside you (attack if there is). Call samurai.rest() if you're low on health when there are no enemies around.

3.description: You sense toads on all sides, you're surrounded!
3.tip: Call samurai.bind(direction) to bind an enemy to keep him from attacking. Bound enemies look like captives.
3.clue: Count the number of enemies around you. Bind an enemy if there are two or more.

4.description: Your ears become more in tune with the surroundings. Listen to find enemies and captives!
4.tip: Use samurai.listen() to find spaces with other units, and samurai.direction_of(space) to determine what direction they're in.
4.clue: Walk towards an enemy or captive with samurai.walk(samurai.direction_of(samurai.listen()[0])). Once samurai.listen() is empty then head for the stairs.

5.description: You can feel the stairs right next to you, but are you sure you want to go up them right away?
5.tip: You'll get more points for clearing the level first. Don't rush to stairs. Prioritize nearby units first, then head toward stairs with samurai.direction_of_stairs().
5.clue: If going towards a unit is the same direction as the stairs, try moving another empty direction until you can safely move toward the enemies.

6.description: What's that ticking? Some captives have a timed bomb at their feet!
6.tip: Hurry and rescue captives first; one of them has a timed bomb.
6.clue: Avoid fighting enemies at first. Use samurai.listen() to find nearby units and rescue captives as quickly as possible.

7.description: Another ticking sound, but some toads are blocking the way.
7.tip: Quickly kill the toads and rescue the captive before the bomb goes off. You can't simply go around them.
7.clue: Determine the direction of the ticking captive and kill any enemies blocking that path. You may need to bind surrounding enemies first.

8.description: You discover a satchel of bombs which will help when facing a mob of enemies.
8.tip: Detonate a bomb when you see a couple enemies ahead of you (samurai.look()). Watch out for your health too.
8.clue: Calling samurai.look() will return an array of Spaces. If the first two contain enemies, detonate a bomb with samurai.detonate().

9.description: Never before have you seen a room so full of toads. Start the fireworks!
9.tip: Be careful not to let the ticking captive get caught in the flames. Use samurai.distance_of to avoid the captives.
9.clue: Be sure to bind the surrounding enemies before fighting. Check your health before detonating explosives.
